par.text: Zinc is a silvery-white metal with a bluish tint. Brittle at room temperature, at 100 – 150
C it is easily rolled and drawn. Above 200

C it becomes brittle again and can be powdered. In contact with air, zinc forms a thin layer of oxide on the surface and loses its lustre. Strongly heated, it burns to produce zinc oxide - ZnO. Zinc was known in ancient times.
